exception.name: ErrorStoringDataFailed
exception.description: This exception is thrown if a storage operation fails when attempting to store data on the device. The Secure Element stores various types of data including device description, configuration parameters, and operational data. If the storage write operation fails, ErrorStoringDataFailed indicates the data could not be successfully written to device storage. Common causes include: device storage errors, storage write failures, corrupted storage, insufficient storage capacity, storage medium issues, or communication failures. ErrorStoringDataFailed indicates that the requested data update was not completed and the device's stored data remains unchanged. This prevents configuration updates and data management operations from completing successfully.

javadoc.summary: This class defines the exception ErrorStoringDataFailed that is thrown if data storage operations fail.
javadoc.description: This exception is thrown when a storage write operation fails while attempting to store data on the Secure Element. The device stores configuration, description, and operational data that must be persisted reliably. ErrorStoringDataFailed indicates that a data storage operation (typically setDescription or initialize) could not complete successfully. Common causes include: device storage write errors, storage medium issues, corrupted storage, insufficient storage capacity, or communication failures during write. ErrorStoringDataFailed is a High severity exception because it prevents configuration updates and data management. The device's stored data remains in its previous state - the failed write does not update the data. Recovery requires investigating the storage issue and potentially retrying the operation or addressing underlying storage problems.

specification.section: 3.2 Device Configuration and 3.3.1 Device Information Operations - Data Storage
specification.requirement: The Secure Element stores device configuration and operational data including device description and initialization data. Operations that update stored data (setDescription, initialize) must persist the data reliably to device storage. If a data storage operation fails to successfully write data to device storage, the function SHALL raise ErrorStoringDataFailed. The device's stored data remains unchanged if the write fails. Data storage failures must be reported clearly so the caller knows the operation did not complete. Storage failures may require addressing underlying storage issues before retry.

condition.description: The device storage system fails to write data successfully
condition.trigger: A setDescription call attempts to store device description but the storage write operation fails (I/O error, hardware issue). ErrorStoringDataFailed is raised.

condition.description: The storage medium has problems or data is corrupted during write
condition.trigger: An initialize call attempts to store initialization data but storage corruption is detected or write fails. ErrorStoringDataFailed is raised.

condition.description: Storage capacity is insufficient to store the data
condition.trigger: A setDescription call attempts to store data but storage is full or insufficient space available. Write cannot complete and ErrorStoringDataFailed is raised.

condition.description: Communication with the device fails during the storage write operation
condition.trigger: An initialize call transmits data for storage but communication is interrupted before write completes. ErrorStoringDataFailed is raised.

condition.description: The storage controller or write verification fails
condition.trigger: A setDescription call initiates storage write but the device storage controller fails or write verification fails. ErrorStoringDataFailed is raised.

executionSequence.step: User/application calls a data storage operation (e.g., setDescription)
Function checks data format and validity
If data invalid → may raise ErrorParameterSyntax instead
If data valid → proceed to step 4
Function initiates communication with Secure Element
Function sends data storage request with data payload to Secure Element
Secure Element receives data storage request
Secure Element attempts to write data to storage
If storage write fails → ErrorStoringDataFailed raised, operation aborted
If storage write succeeds → proceed to step 9
Secure Element verifies write completion and data integrity
If verification succeeds → proceed to step 10
Secure Element returns success acknowledgment to function
Function closes communication with Secure Element

recovery.step: Review error message - examine the error message to understand the storage failure reason
Check device state - query device to verify it is operational and responsive
Check storage status - query device storage for capacity and status information
Check storage connectivity - verify storage is accessible and operational
Verify data validity - ensure the data being stored is valid and well-formed
Check storage capacity - verify sufficient storage space is available
Retry the operation - attempt the data storage operation again
Device reset - power cycle the device to recover from potential storage issue
Check device logs - examine device logs for storage error details
If persistent, contact manufacturer - device may have storage hardware issues

notes.note: ErrorStoringDataFailed is thrown by 2 functions: setDescription, initialize
This exception indicates a storage write failure, not data validation failure
The exception has High severity because it prevents configuration and data management
Data storage is critical for device configuration and operation
Storage write failures may indicate hardware or capacity issues
Failed writes do not update the device's stored data - previous values remain
Storage capacity must be verified before attempting data writes
Communication reliability is important during data storage operations
Data should be validated before transmission to device for storage
Error messages should indicate whether issue is capacity, connectivity, or hardware
Device should not corrupt or lose data during failed storage operations
Storage integrity should be verified after write operations
Device should provide clear status on storage health and capacity
Retry logic should include delays to allow temporary issues to resolve
Data persistence is essential for configuration management across device resets

scenario.name: Scenario 1: Device Description Update with Storage Failure
scenario.description: An administrator calls setDescription to update device description. The device storage fails during write. ErrorStoringDataFailed is raised. The administrator verifies device storage status and retries the update.
scenario.errorContext: Device configuration update blocked by storage write failure

scenario.name: Scenario 2: Device Initialization with Storage Issue
scenario.description: Device initialization calls initialize to store initialization data but the storage write fails. ErrorStoringDataFailed is raised. Device initialization is incomplete and must be retried after checking storage.
scenario.errorContext: Device initialization fails due to storage write error

scenario.name: Scenario 3: Storage Capacity Management
scenario.description: A setDescription call fails with ErrorStoringDataFailed due to insufficient storage. System exports and deletes old logs to free storage space, then retries the description update successfully.
scenario.errorContext: Storage write failure due to capacity - resolved by freeing storage space

scenario.name: Scenario 4: Troubleshooting Storage Reliability
scenario.description: Multiple ErrorStoringDataFailed exceptions occur during routine configuration updates. Investigation reveals storage device is degrading. Device is replaced before catastrophic storage failure occurs.
scenario.errorContext: Repeated storage failures trigger device replacement due to storage degradation

Storage write should be verified and data integrity checked after write
Communication during storage operations must be reliable with error checking
